summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was fully God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Word was with God in the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All things were created by him, and apart from him not one thing was created that has been created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In him was life, and the life was the light of mankind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the light shines on in the darkness, but the darkness has not mastered it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man came, sent from God, whose name was John.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came as a witness to testify about the light, so that everyone might believe through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself was not the light, but he came to testify about the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The true light, who gives light to everyone, was coming into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the world, and the world was created by him, but the world did not recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to what was his own, but his own people did not receive him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to all who have received him—those who believe in his name—he has given the right to become God’s children
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: —children not born by human parents or by human desire or a husband’s decision, but by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Word became flesh and took up residence among us. We saw his glory—the glory of the one and only, full of grace and truth, who came from the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John testified about him and shouted out, “This one was the one about whom I said, ‘He who comes after me is greater than I am, because he existed before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we have all received from his fullness one gracious gift after another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law was given through Moses, but grace and truth came about through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has ever seen God. The only one, himself God, who is in closest fellowship with the Father, has made God known.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this was John’s testimony when the Jewish leaders sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He confessed—he did not deny but confessed—“I am not the Christ!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “Then who are you? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not!” “Are you the Prophet?” He answered, “No!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “Who are you? Tell us so that we can give an answer to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John said, “I am the voice of one shouting in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way for the Lord,’ as the prophet Isaiah said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now they had been sent from the Pharisees.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked John, “Why then are you baptizing if you are not the Christ, nor Elijah, nor the Prophet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John answered them, “I baptize with water. Among you stands one whom you do not recognize,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who is coming after me. I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandal!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things happened in Bethany across the Jordan River where John was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the one about whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is greater than I am, because he existed before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not recognize him, but I came baptizing with water so that he could be revealed to Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then John testified, “I saw the Spirit descending like a dove from heaven, and it remained on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I did not recognize him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘The one on whom you see the Spirit descending and remaining—this is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have both seen and testified that this man is the Chosen One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again the next day John was standing there with two of his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Gazing at Jesus as he walked by, he said, “Look, the Lamb of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s two disciples heard him say this, they followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus turned around and saw them following and said to them, “What do you want?” So they said to him, “Rabbi” (which is translated Teacher), “where are you staying?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Come and you will see.” So they came and saw where he was staying, and they stayed with him that day. Now it was about four o’clock in the afternoon.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the two disciples who heard what John said and followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He first found his own brother Simon and told him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which is translated Christ).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew brought Simon to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, “You are Simon, the son of John. You will be called Cephas” (which is translated Peter).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: On the next day Jesus wanted to set out for Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: (Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the town of Andrew and Peter.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip found Nathanael and told him, “We have found the one Moses wrote about in the law, and the prophets also wrote about—Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nathanael replied, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip replied, “Come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him and exclaimed, “Look, a true Israelite in whom there is no deceit!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael asked him, “How do you know me?” Jesus replied, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nathanael answered him, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God; you are the king of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree, do you believe? You will see greater things than these.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He continued, “I tell all of you the solemn truth—you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now on the third day there was a wedding at Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus and his disciples were also invited to the wedding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the wine ran out, Jesus’ mother said to him, “They have no wine left.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Woman, why are you saying this to me? My time has not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His mother told the servants, “Whatever he tells you, do it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there were six stone water jars there for Jewish ceremonial washing, each holding twenty or thirty gallons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told the servants, “Fill the water jars with water.” So they filled them up to the very top.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he told them, “Now draw some out and take it to the head steward,” and they did.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the head steward tasted the water that had been turned to wine, not knowing where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew), he called the bridegroom
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first, and then the cheaper wine when the guests are drunk. You have kept the good wine until now!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus did this as the first of his miraculous signs, in Cana of Galilee. In this way he revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this he went down to Capernaum with his mother and brothers and his disciples, and they stayed there a few days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jewish feast of Passover was near, so Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He found in the temple courts those who were selling oxen and sheep and doves, and the money changers sitting at tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he made a whip of cords and drove them all out of the temple courts, with the sheep and the oxen. He scattered the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To those who sold the doves he said, “Take these things away from here! Do not make my Father’s house a marketplace!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will devour me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then the Jewish leaders responded, “What sign can you show us, since you are doing these things?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Destroy this temple and in three days I will raise it up again.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders said to him, “This temple has been under construction for forty-six years, and are you going to raise it up in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus was speaking about the temple of his body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So after he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the scripture and the saying that Jesus had spoken.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now while Jesus was in Jerusalem at the Feast of the Passover, many people believed in his name because they saw the miraculous signs he was doing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus would not entrust himself to them, because he knew all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not need anyone to testify about man, for he knew what was in man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man, a Pharisee named Nicodemus, who was a member of the Jewish ruling council,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: came to Jesus at night and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God. For no one could perform the miraculous signs that you do unless God is with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless a person is born from above, he cannot see the kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? He cannot enter his mother’s womb and be born a second time, can he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless a person is born of water and spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: What is born of the flesh is flesh, and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not be amazed that I said to you, ‘You must all be born from above.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind blows wherever it will, and you hear the sound it makes, but do not know where it comes from and where it is going. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Nicodemus replied, “How can these things be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Are you the teacher of Israel and yet you don’t understand these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, we speak about what we know and testify about what we have seen, but you people do not accept our testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: If I have told you people about earthly things and you don’t believe, how will you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one has ascended into heaven except the one who descended from heaven—the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that everyone who believes in him may have eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For this is the way God loved the world: He gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but that the world should be saved through him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who believes in him is not condemned. The one who does not believe has been condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now this is the basis for judging: that the light has come into the world and people loved the darkness rather than the light, because their deeds were evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For everyone who does evil deeds hates the light and does not come to the light, so that their deeds will not be exposed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But the one who practices the truth comes to the light, so that it may be plainly evident that his deeds have been done in God.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: After this, Jesus and his disciples came into Judean territory, and there he spent time with them and was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was also baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because water was plentiful there, and people were coming to him and being baptized.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For John had not yet been thrown into prison.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a dispute came about between some of John’s disciples and a certain Jew concerning ceremonial washing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, the one who was with you on the other side of the Jordan River, about whom you testified—see, he is baptizing, and everyone is flocking to him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John replied, “No one can receive anything unless it has been given to him from heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You yourselves can testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but rather, ‘I have been sent before him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend of the bridegroom, who stands by and listens for him, rejoices greatly when he hears the bridegroom’s voice. This then is my joy, and it is complete.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He must become more important while I become less important.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who comes from above is superior to all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks about earthly things. The one who comes from heaven is superior to all.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He testifies about what he has seen and heard, but no one accepts his testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who has accepted his testimony has confirmed clearly that God is truthful.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For the one whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for he does not give the Spirit sparingly.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loves the Son and has placed all things under his authority.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The one who believes in the Son has eternal life. The one who rejects the Son will not see life, but God’s wrath remains on him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Now when Jesus knew that the Pharisees had heard that he was winning and baptizing more disciples than John
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (although Jesus himself was not baptizing, but his disciples were),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he left Judea and set out once more for Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he had to pass through Samaria.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he came to a Samaritan town called Sychar, near the plot of land that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob’s well was there, so Jesus, since he was tired from the journey, sat right down beside the well. It was about noon.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A Samaritan woman came to draw water. Jesus said to her, “Give me some water to drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For his disciples had gone off into the town to buy supplies.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Samaritan woman said to him, “How can you—a Jew—ask me, a Samaritan woman, for water to drink?” (For Jews use nothing in common with Samaritans.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered her, “If you had known the gift of God and who it is who said to you, ‘Give me some water to drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sir,” the woman said to him, “you have no bucket and the well is deep; where then do you get this living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely you’re not greater than our ancestor Jacob, are you? For he gave us this well and drank from it himself, along with his sons and his livestock.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Everyone who drinks some of this water will be thirsty again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whoever drinks some of the water that I will give him will never be thirsty again, but the water that I will give him will become in him a fountain of water springing up to eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I will not be thirsty or have to come here to draw water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said to her, “Go call your husband and come back here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman replied, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “Right you are when you said, ‘I have no husband,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have had five husbands, and the man you are living with now is not your husband. This you said truthfully!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “Sir, I see that you are a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our fathers worshiped on this mountain, and you people say that the place where people must worship is in Jerusalem.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Believe me, woman, a time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You people worship what you do not know. We worship what we know, because salvation is from the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But a time is coming—and now is here—when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such people to be his worshipers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God is spirit, and the people who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (the one called Christ); “whenever he comes, he will tell us everything.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I, the one speaking to you, am he.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at that very moment his disciples came back. They were shocked because he was speaking with a woman. However, no one said, “What do you want?” or “Why are you speaking with her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the woman left her water jar, went off into the town and said to the people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, see a man who told me everything I ever did. Surely he can’t be the Messiah, can he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they left the town and began coming to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile the disciples were urging him, “Rabbi, eat something.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you know nothing about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples began to say to one another, “No one brought him anything to eat, did they?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of the one who sent me and to complete his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you say, ‘There are four more months and then comes the harvest?’ I tell you, look up and see that the fields are already white for harvest!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who reaps receives pay and gathers fruit for eternal life, so that the one who sows and the one who reaps can rejoice together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this instance the saying is true, ‘One sows and another reaps.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent you to reap what you did not work for; others have labored and you have entered into their labor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now many Samaritans from that town believed in him because of the report of the woman who testified, “He told me everything I ever did.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they began asking him to stay with them. He stayed there two days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and because of his word many more believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to the woman, “No longer do we believe because of your words, for we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this one really is the Savior of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the two days he departed from there to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in his own country.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him because they had seen all the things he had done in Jerusalem at the feast (for they themselves had gone to the feast).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now he came again to Cana in Galilee where he had made the water wine. In Capernaum there was a certain royal official whose son was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that Jesus had come back from Judea to Galilee, he went to him and begged him to come down and heal his son, who was about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to him, “Unless you people see signs and wonders you will never believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sir,” the official said to him, “come down before my child dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Go home; your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him, and set off for home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was on his way down, his slaves met him and told him that his son was going to live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he asked them the time when his condition began to improve, and they told him, “Yesterday at one o’clock in the afternoon the fever left him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father realized that it was the very time Jesus had said to him, “Your son will live,” and he himself believed along with his entire household.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus did this as his second miraculous sign when he returned from Judea to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this there was a Jewish feast, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now there is in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate a pool called Bethzatha in Aramaic, which has five covered walkways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A great number of sick, blind, lame, and paralyzed people were lying in these walkways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a man was there who had been disabled for thirty-eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw him lying there and when he realized that the man had been disabled a long time already, he said to him, “Do you want to become well?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sick man answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up. While I am trying to get into the water, someone else goes down there before me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Stand up! Pick up your mat and walk.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Immediately the man was healed, and he picked up his mat and started walking. (Now that day was a Sabbath.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders said to the man who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath, and you are not permitted to carry your mat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he answered them, “The man who made me well said to me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Pick up your mat and walk’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the man who had been healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had slipped out, since there was a crowd in that place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, “Look, you have become well. Don’t sin any more, lest anything worse happen to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man went away and informed the Jewish leaders that Jesus was the one who had made him well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now because Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath, the Jewish leaders began persecuting him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them, “My Father is working until now, and I too am working.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason the Jewish leaders were trying even harder to kill him, because not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was also calling God his own Father, thus making himself equal with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus answered them, “I tell you the solemn truth, the Son can do nothing on his own initiative, but only what he sees the Father doing. For whatever the Father does, the Son does likewise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything he does, and will show him greater deeds than these, so that you will be amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so also the Son gives life to whomever he wishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Furthermore, the Father does not judge anyone, but has assigned all judgment to the Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that all people will honor the Son just as they honor the Father. The one who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the solemn truth, the one who hears my message and believes the one who sent me has eternal life and will not be condemned, but has crossed over from death to life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, a time is coming—and is now here—when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the Father has life in himself, thus he has granted the Son to have life in himself,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he has granted the Son authority to execute judgment, because he is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be amazed at this, because a time is coming when all who are in the tombs will hear his voice
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and will come out—the ones who have done what is good to the resurrection resulting in life, and the ones who have done what is evil to the resurrection resulting in condemnation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can do nothing on my own initiative. Just as I hear, I judge, and my judgment is just, because I do not seek my own will, but the will of the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I testify about myself, my testimony is not true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is another who testifies about me, and I know the testimony he testifies about me is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have sent to John, and he has testified to the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (I do not accept human testimony, but I say this so that you may be saved.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was a lamp that was burning and shining, and you wanted to rejoice greatly for a short time in his light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I have a testimony greater than that from John. For the deeds that the Father has assigned me to complete—the deeds I am now doing—testify about me that the Father has sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Father who sent me has himself testified about me. You people have never heard his voice nor seen his form at any time,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: nor do you have his word residing in you, because you do not believe the one whom he sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You study the scriptures thoroughly because you think in them you possess eternal life, and it is these same scriptures that testify about me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you are not willing to come to me so that you may have life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I do not accept praise from people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I know you, that you do not have the love of God within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you do not accept me. If someone else comes in his own name, you will accept him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How can you believe, if you accept praise from one another and don’t seek the praise that comes from the only God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not suppose that I will accuse you before the Father. The one who accuses you is Moses, in whom you have placed your hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you believed Moses, you would believe me, because he wrote about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you do not believe what Moses wrote, how will you believe my words?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus went away to the other side of the Sea of Galilee (also called the Sea of Tiberias).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A large crowd was following him because they were observing the miraculous signs he was performing on the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus went on up the mountainside and sat down there with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the Jewish Feast of the Passover was near.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, when he looked up and saw that a large crowd was coming to him, said to Philip, “Where can we buy bread so that these people may eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus said this to test him, for he knew what he was going to do.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip replied, “200 silver coins worth of bread would not be enough for them, for each one to get a little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of Jesus’ disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Here is a boy who has five barley loaves and two fish, but what good are these for so many people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Have the people sit down.” (Now there was a lot of grass in that place.) So the men sat down, about 5,000 in number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the loaves, and when he had given thanks, he distributed the bread to those who were seated. He then did the same with the fish, as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they were all satisfied, Jesus said to his disciples, “Gather up the broken pieces that are left over, so that nothing is wasted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they gathered them up and filled twelve baskets with broken pieces from the five barley loaves left over by the people who had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the people saw the miraculous sign that Jesus performed, they began to say to one another, “This is certainly the Prophet who is to come into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, because he knew they were going to come and seize him by force to make him king, withdrew again up the mountainside alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when evening came, his disciples went down to the lake,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: got into a boat, and started to cross the lake to Capernaum. (It had already become dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By now a strong wind was blowing and the sea was getting rough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, when they had rowed about three or four miles, they caught sight of Jesus walking on the lake, approaching the boat, and they were frightened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said to them, “It is I. Do not be afraid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they wanted to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat came to the land where they had been heading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the crowd that remained on the other side of the lake realized that only one small boat had been there, and that Jesus had not boarded it with his disciples, but that his disciples had gone away alone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Other boats from Tiberias came to shore near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the crowd realized that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and came to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they found him on the other side of the lake, they said to him, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you the solemn truth, you are looking for me not because you saw miraculous signs, but because you ate all the loaves of bread you wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not work for the food that disappears, but for the food that remains to eternal life—the food which the Son of Man will give to you. For God the Father has put his seal of approval on him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then they said to him, “What must we do to accomplish the deeds God requires?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “This is the deed God requires—to believe in the one whom he sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Then what miraculous sign will you perform, so that we may see it and believe you? What will you do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, just as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “I tell you the solemn truth, it is not Moses who has given you the bread from heaven, but my Father is giving you the true bread from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Sir, give us this bread all the time!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. The one who comes to me will never go hungry, and the one who believes in me will never be thirsty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I told you that you have seen me and still do not believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone whom the Father gives me will come to me, and the one who comes to me I will never send away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have come down from heaven not to do my own will but the will of the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is the will of the one who sent me—that I should not lose one person of every one he has given me, but raise them all up at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is the will of my Father—for everyone who looks on the Son and believes in him to have eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews who were hostile to Jesus began complaining about him because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they said, “Isn’t this Jesus the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Do not complain about me to one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him, and I will raise him up at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in the prophets, ‘And they will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who hears and learns from the Father comes to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God—he has seen the Father.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, the one who believes has eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the bread of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread that has come down from heaven, so that a person may eat from it and not die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. If anyone eats from this bread he will live forever. The bread that I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jews who were hostile to Jesus began to argue with one another, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the solemn truth, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in yourselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up on the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who eats my flesh and drinks my blood resides in me, and I in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as the living Father sent me, and I live because of the Father, so the one who consumes me will live because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the bread that came down from heaven; it is not like the bread your ancestors ate, but then later died. The one who eats this bread will live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said these things while he was teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many of his disciples, when they heard these things, said, “This is a difficult saying! Who can understand it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus was aware that his disciples were complaining about this, he said to them, “Does this cause you to be offended?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what if you see the Son of Man ascending where he was before?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit is the one who gives life; human nature is of no help! The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and are life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But there are some of you who do not believe.” (For Jesus had already known from the beginning who those were who did not believe, and who it was who would betray him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus added, “Because of this I told you that no one can come to me unless the Father has allowed him to come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this many of his disciples quit following him and did not accompany him any longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to the twelve, “You don’t want to go away too, do you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have come to believe and to know that you are the Holy One of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Didn’t I choose you, the twelve, and yet one of you is the devil?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he said this about Judas son of Simon Iscariot, for Judas, one of the twelve, was going to betray him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus traveled throughout Galilee. He stayed out of Judea because the Jewish leaders wanted to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jewish Feast of Shelters was near.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus’ brothers advised him, “Leave here and go to Judea so your disciples may see your miracles that you are performing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one who seeks to make a reputation for himself does anything in secret. If you are doing these things, show yourself to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For not even his own brothers believed in him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus replied, “My time has not yet arrived, but you are ready at any opportunity!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me, because I am testifying about it that its deeds are evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go up to the feast yourselves. I am not going up to this feast because my time has not yet fully arrived.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said this, he remained in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when his brothers had gone up to the feast, then Jesus himself also went up, not openly but in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders were looking for him at the feast, asking, “Where is he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a lot of grumbling about him among the crowds. Some were saying, “He is a good man,” but others, “He deceives the common people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, no one spoke openly about him for fear of the Jewish leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the feast was half over, Jesus went up to the temple courts and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders were astonished and said, “How does this man know so much when he has never had formal instruction?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus replied, “My teaching is not from me, but from the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to do God’s will, he will know about my teaching, whether it is from God or whether I speak from my own authority.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who speaks on his own authority desires to receive honor for himself; the one who desires the honor of the one who sent him is a man of integrity, and there is no unrighteousness in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hasn’t Moses given you the law? Yet not one of you keeps the law! Why do you want to kill me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd answered, “You’re possessed by a demon! Who is trying to kill you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I performed one miracle and you are all amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, because Moses gave you the practice of circumcision (not that it came from Moses, but from the forefathers), you circumcise a male child on the Sabbath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if a male child is circumcised on the Sabbath so that the law of Moses is not broken, why are you angry with me because I made a man completely well on the Sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do not judge according to external appearance, but judge with proper judgment.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the residents of Jerusalem began to say, “Isn’t this the man they are trying to kill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet here he is, speaking publicly, and they are saying nothing to him. Do the ruling authorities really know that this man is the Christ?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we know where this man comes from. Whenever the Christ comes, no one will know where he comes from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, while teaching in the temple courts, cried out, “You both know me and know where I come from! And I have not come on my own initiative, but the one who sent me is true. You do not know him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I know him, because I have come from him and he sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then they tried to seize Jesus, but no one laid a hand on him, because his time had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet many of the crowd believed in him and said, “Whenever the Christ comes, he won’t perform more miraculous signs than this man did, will he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees heard the crowd murmuring these things about Jesus, so the chief priests and the Pharisees sent officers to arrest him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “I will be with you for only a little while longer, and then I am going to the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will look for me but will not find me, and where I am you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Jewish leaders said to one another, “Where is he going to go that we cannot find him? He is not going to go to the Jewish people dispersed among the Greeks and teach the Greeks, is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What did he mean by saying, ‘You will look for me but will not find me, and where I am you cannot come’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the last day of the feast, the greatest day, Jesus stood up and shouted out, “If anyone is thirsty, let him come to me, and
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: let the one who believes in me drink. Just as the scripture says, ‘From within him will flow rivers of living water.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he said this about the Spirit, whom those who believed in him were going to receive, for the Spirit had not yet been given, because Jesus was not yet glorified.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they heard these words, some of the crowd began to say, “This really is the Prophet!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “This is the Christ!” But still others said, “No, for the Christ doesn’t come from Galilee, does he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t the scriptures say that the Christ is a descendant of David and comes from Bethlehem, the village where David lived?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So there was a division in the crowd because of Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of them were wanting to seize him, but no one laid a hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the officers returned to the chief priests and Pharisees, who said to them, “Why didn’t you bring him back with you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The officers replied, “No one ever spoke like this man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees answered, “You haven’t been deceived too, have you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the members of the ruling council or the Pharisees have believed in him, have they?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But this rabble who do not know the law are accursed!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus, who had gone to Jesus before and who was one of the rulers, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Our law doesn’t condemn a man unless it first hears from him and learns what he is doing, does it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “You aren’t from Galilee too, are you? Investigate carefully and you will see that no prophet comes from Galilee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And each one departed to his own house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early in the morning he came to the temple courts again. All the people came to him, and he sat down and began to teach them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The experts in the law and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught committing adultery. They made her stand in front of them
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to Jesus, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the law Moses commanded us to stone to death such women. What then do you say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now they were asking this in an attempt to trap him, so that they could bring charges against him.) Jesus bent down and wrote on the ground with his finger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they persisted in asking him, he stood up straight and replied, “Whoever among you is guiltless may be the first to throw a stone at her.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he bent over again and wrote on the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when they heard this, they began to drift away one at a time, starting with the older ones, until Jesus was left alone with the woman standing before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus stood up straight and said to her, “Woman, where are they? Did no one condemn you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She replied, “No one, Lord.” And Jesus said, “I do not condemn you either. Go, and from now on do not sin any more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus spoke out again, “I am the light of the world! The one who follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees objected, “You testify about yourself; your testimony is not true!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Even if I testify about myself, my testimony is true, because I know where I came from and where I am going. But you people do not know where I came from or where I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You people judge by outward appearances; I do not judge anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I judge, my evaluation is accurate, because I am not alone when I judge, but I and the Father who sent me do so together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is written in your law that the testimony of two men is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I testify about myself and the Father who sent me testifies about me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they began asking him, “Who is your father?” Jesus answered, “You do not know either me or my Father. If you knew me you would know my Father too.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Jesus spoke these words near the offering box while he was teaching in the temple courts. No one seized him because his time had not yet come.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to them again, “I am going away, and you will look for me but will die in your sin. Where I am going you cannot come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders began to say, “Perhaps he is going to kill himself, because he says, ‘Where I am going you cannot come.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You people are from below; I am from above. You people are from this world; I am not from this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus I told you that you will die in your sins. For unless you believe that I am he, you will die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said to him, “Who are you?” Jesus replied, “What I have told you from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have many things to say and to judge about you, but the Father who sent me is truthful, and the things I have heard from him I speak to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (They did not understand that he was telling them about his Father.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “When you lift up the Son of Man, then you will know that I am he, and I do nothing on my own initiative, but I speak just what the Father taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who sent me is with me. He has not left me alone, because I always do those things that please him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was saying these things, many people believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said to those Judeans who had believed him, “If you continue to follow my teaching, you are really my disciples
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We are descendants of Abraham,” they replied, “and have never been anyone’s slaves! How can you say, ‘You will become free’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered them, “I tell you the solemn truth, everyone who practices sin is a slave of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The slave does not remain in the family forever, but the son remains forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if the son sets you free, you will be really free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that you are Abraham’s descendants. But you want to kill me, because my teaching makes no progress among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am telling you the things I have seen while with the Father; as for you, practice the things you have heard from the Father!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered him, “Abraham is our father!” Jesus replied, “If you are Abraham’s children, you would be doing the deeds of Abraham.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now you are trying to kill me, a man who has told you the truth I heard from God. Abraham did not do this!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You people are doing the deeds of your father.”
Then they said to Jesus, “We were not born as a result of immorality! We have only one Father, God himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If God were your Father, you would love me, for I have come from God and am now here. I have not come on my own initiative, but he sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why don’t you understand what I am saying? It is because you cannot accept my teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You people are from your father the devil, and you want to do what your father desires. He was a murderer from the beginning, and does not uphold the truth, because there is no truth in him. Whenever he lies, he speaks according to his own nature, because he is a liar and the father of lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But because I am telling you the truth, you do not believe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who among you can prove me guilty of any sin? If I am telling you the truth, why don’t you believe me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who belongs to God listens and responds to God’s words. You don’t listen and respond, because you don’t belong to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Judeans replied, “Aren’t we correct in saying that you are a Samaritan and are possessed by a demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I am not possessed by a demon, but I honor my Father—and yet you dishonor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not trying to get praise for myself. There is one who demands it, and he also judges.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, if anyone obeys my teaching, he will never see death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Judeans responded, “Now we know you’re possessed by a demon! Both Abraham and the prophets died, and yet you say, ‘If anyone obeys my teaching, he will never experience death.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You aren’t greater than our father Abraham who died, are you? And the prophets died too! Who do you claim to be?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If I glorify myself, my glory is worthless. The one who glorifies me is my Father, about whom you people say, ‘He is our God.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you do not know him, but I know him. If I were to say that I do not know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him, and I obey his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your father Abraham was overjoyed to see my day, and he saw it and was glad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Judeans replied, “You are not yet fifty years old! Have you seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I tell you the solemn truth, before Abraham came into existence, I am!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they picked up stones to throw at him, but Jesus was hidden from them and went out from the temple area.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now as Jesus was passing by, he saw a man who had been blind from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who committed the sin that caused him to be born blind, this man or his parents?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned, but he was born blind so that the acts of God may be revealed through what happens to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must perform the deeds of the one who sent me as long as it is daytime. Night is coming when no one can work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Having said this, he spat on the ground and made some mud with the saliva. He smeared the mud on the blind man’s eyes
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and said to him, “Go wash in the pool of Siloam” (which is translated “sent”). So the blind man went away and washed, and came back seeing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the neighbors and the people who had seen him previously as a beggar began saying, “Is this not the man who used to sit and beg?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some people said, “This is the man!” while others said, “No, but he looks like him.” The man himself kept insisting, “I am the one!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they asked him, “How then were you made to see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “The man called Jesus made mud, smeared it on my eyes and told me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash.’ So I went and washed, and was able to see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to him, “Where is that man?” He replied, “I don’t know.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought the man who used to be blind to the Pharisees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the day on which Jesus made the mud and caused him to see was a Sabbath.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Pharisees asked him again how he had gained his sight. He replied, “He put mud on my eyes and I washed, and now I am able to see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of the Pharisees began to say, “This man is not from God, because he does not observe the Sabbath.” But others said, “How can a man who is a sinner perform such miraculous signs?” Thus there was a division among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So again they asked the man who used to be blind, “What do you say about him, since he caused you to see?” “He is a prophet,” the man replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jewish religious leaders refused to believe that he had really been blind and had gained his sight until at last they summoned the parents of the man who had become able to see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked the parents, “Is this your son, whom you say was born blind? Then how does he now see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So his parents replied, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we do not know how he is now able to see, nor do we know who caused him to see. Ask him, he is a mature adult. He will speak for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (His parents said these things because they were afraid of the Jewish religious leaders. For the Jewish leaders had already agreed that anyone who confessed Jesus to be the Christ would be put out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason his parents said, “He is a mature adult, ask him.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they summoned the man who used to be blind a second time and said to him, “Promise before God to tell the truth. We know that this man is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He replied, “I do not know whether he is a sinner. I do know one thing—that although I was blind, now I can see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to him, “What did he do to you? How did he cause you to see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He answered, “I told you already and you didn’t listen. Why do you want to hear it again? You people don’t want to become his disciples too, do you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They heaped insults on him, saying, “You are his disciple! We are disciples of Moses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God has spoken to Moses! We do not know where this man comes from!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, “This is a remarkable thing, that you don’t know where he comes from, and yet he caused me to see!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God doesn’t listen to sinners, but if anyone is devout and does his will, God listens to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Never before has anyone heard of someone causing a man born blind to see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “You were born completely in sinfulness, and yet you presume to teach us?” So they threw him out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus heard that they had thrown him out, so he found the man and said to him, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man replied, “And who is he, sir, that I may believe in him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “You have seen him; he is the one speaking with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: [He said, “Lord, I believe,” and he worshiped him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said,] “For judgment I have come into this world, so that those who do not see may gain their sight, and the ones who see may become blind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees who were with him heard this and asked him, “We are not blind too, are we?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If you were blind, you would not be guilty of sin, but now because you claim that you can see, your guilt remains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the solemn truth, the one who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs in some other way, is a thief and a robber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The doorkeeper opens the door for him, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he has brought all his own sheep out, he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they recognize his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will never follow a stranger, but will run away from him, because they do not recognize the stranger’s voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them this parable, but they did not understand what he was saying to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said again, “I tell you the solemn truth, I am the door for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who came before me were thieves and robbers, but the sheep did not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the door. If anyone enters through me, he will be saved, and will come in and go out, and find pasture.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come so that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hired hand, who is not a shepherd and does not own sheep, sees the wolf coming and abandons the sheep and runs away. So the wolf attacks the sheep and scatters them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because he is a hired hand and is not concerned about the sheep, he runs away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd. I know my own and my own know me—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as the Father knows me and I know the Father—and I lay down my life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have other sheep that do not come from this sheepfold. I must bring them too, and they will listen to my voice, so that there will be one flock and one shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is why the Father loves me—because I lay down my life, so that I may take it back again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one takes it away from me, but I lay it down of my own free will. I have the authority to lay it down, and I have the authority to take it back again. This commandment I received from my Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Another sharp division took place among the Jewish people because of these words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of them were saying, “He is possessed by a demon and has lost his mind! Why do you listen to him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “These are not the words of someone possessed by a demon. A demon cannot cause the blind to see, can it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came the feast of the Dedication in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was winter, and Jesus was walking in the temple area in Solomon’s Portico.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders surrounded him and asked, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us plainly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I told you and you do not believe. The deeds I do in my Father’s name testify about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you refuse to believe because you are not my sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep listen to my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give them eternal life, and they will never perish; no one will snatch them from my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father, who has given them to me, is greater than all, and no one can snatch them from my Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father and I are one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders picked up rocks again to stone him to death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to them, “I have shown you many good deeds from the Father. For which one of them are you going to stone me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders replied, “We are not going to stone you for a good deed but for blasphemy, because you, a man, are claiming to be God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If those people to whom the word of God came were called ‘gods’ (and the scripture cannot be broken),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: do you say about the one whom the Father set apart and sent into the world, ‘You are blaspheming,’ because I said, ‘I am the Son of God’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I do not perform the deeds of my Father, do not believe me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I do them, even if you do not believe me, believe the deeds, so that you may come to know and understand that I am in the Father and the Father is in me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they attempted again to seize him, but he escaped their clutches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus went back across the Jordan River again to the place where John had been baptizing at an earlier time, and he stayed there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many came to him and began to say, “John performed no miraculous sign, but everything John said about this man was true!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many believed in Jesus there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a certain man named Lazarus was sick. He was from Bethany, the village where Mary and her sister Martha lived.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now it was Mary who anointed the Lord with perfumed oil and wiped his feet dry with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the sisters sent a message to Jesus, “Lord, look, the one you love is sick.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard this, he said, “This sickness will not lead to death, but to God’s glory, so that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when he heard that Lazarus was sick, he remained in the place where he was for two more days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then after this, he said to his disciples, “Let us go to Judea again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples replied, “Rabbi, the Jewish leaders were just now trying to stone you to death! Are you going there again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Are there not twelve hours in a day? If anyone walks around in the daytime, he does not stumble, because he sees the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone walks around at night, he stumbles, because the light is not in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he said this, he added, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep. But I am going there to awaken him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciples replied, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will recover.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus had been talking about his death, but they thought he had been talking about real sleep.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them plainly, “Lazarus has died,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and I am glad for your sake that I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Thomas (called Didymus) said to his fellow disciples, “Let us go too, so that we may die with him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus arrived, he found that Lazarus had been in the tomb four days already.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Bethany was less than two miles from Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so many of the Jewish people of the region had come to Martha and Mary to console them over the loss of their brother.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went out to meet him, but Mary was sitting in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even now I know that whatever you ask from God, God will grant you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Your brother will come back to life again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said, “I know that he will come back to life again in the resurrection at the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live even if he dies,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one who lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She replied, “Yes, Lord, I believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God who comes into the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when she had said this, Martha went and called her sister Mary, saying privately, “The Teacher is here and is asking for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Mary heard this, she got up quickly and went to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus had not yet entered the village, but was still in the place where Martha had come out to meet him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people who were with Mary in the house consoling her saw her get up quickly and go out. They followed her, because they thought she was going to the tomb to weep there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Mary came to the place where Jesus was and saw him, she fell at his feet and said to him, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her weeping, and the people who had come with her weeping, he was intensely moved in spirit and greatly distressed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked, “Where have you laid him?” They replied, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the people who had come to mourn said, “Look how much he loved him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them said, “This is the man who caused the blind man to see! Couldn’t he have done something to keep Lazarus from dying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus, intensely moved again, came to the tomb. (Now it was a cave, and a stone was placed across it.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of the deceased, replied, “Lord, by this time the body will have a bad smell, because he has been buried four days.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “Didn’t I tell you that if you believe, you would see the glory of God?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took away the stone. Jesus looked upward and said, “Father, I thank you that you have listened to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I knew that you always listen to me, but I said this for the sake of the crowd standing around here, that they may believe that you sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said this, he shouted in a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who had died came out, his feet and hands tied up with strips of cloth, and a cloth wrapped around his face. Jesus said to them, “Unwrap him and let him go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many of the people, who had come with Mary and had seen the things Jesus did, believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of them went to the Pharisees and reported to them what Jesus had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief priests and the Pharisees called the council together and said, “What are we doing? For this man is performing many miraculous signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we allow him to go on in this way, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and take away our sanctuary and our nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of them, Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, said, “You know nothing at all!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You do not realize that it is more to your advantage to have one man die for the people than for the whole nation to perish.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he did not say this on his own, but because he was high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus was going to die for the Jewish nation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not for the Jewish nation only, but to gather together into one the children of God who are scattered.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from that day they planned together to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus Jesus no longer went around publicly among the Judeans, but went away from there to the region near the wilderness, to a town called Ephraim, and stayed there with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Jewish Feast of Passover was near, and many people went up to Jerusalem from the rural areas before the Passover to cleanse themselves ritually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus they were looking for Jesus, and saying to one another as they stood in the temple courts, “What do you think? That he won’t come to the feast?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who knew where Jesus was should report it, so that they could arrest him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, six days before the Passover, Jesus came to Bethany, where Lazarus lived, whom he had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they prepared a dinner for Jesus there. Martha was serving, and Lazarus was among those present at the table with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary took three quarters of a pound of expensive aromatic oil from pure nard and anointed the feet of Jesus. She then wiped his feet dry with her hair. (Now the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfumed oil.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples (the one who was going to betray him) said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why wasn’t this oil sold for 300 silver coins and the money given to the poor?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Judas said this not because he was concerned about the poor, but because he was a thief. As keeper of the money box, he used to steal what was put into it.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She has kept it for the day of my burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you will always have the poor with you, but you will not always have me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now a large crowd of Judeans learned that Jesus was there, and so they came not only because of him but also to see Lazarus whom he had raised from the dead.
