verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the chief priests planned to kill Lazarus too,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for on account of him many of the Jewish people from Jerusalem were going away and believing in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the large crowd that had come to the feast heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet him. They began to shout, “Hosanna! Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord! Blessed is the king of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, just as it is written,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not be afraid, people of Zion; look, your king is coming, seated on a donkey’s colt!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (His disciples did not understand these things when they first happened, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things were written about him and that these things had happened to him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the crowd who had been with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead were continuing to testify about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because they had heard that Jesus had performed this miraculous sign, the crowd went out to meet him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus the Pharisees said to one another, “You see that you can do nothing. Look, the world has run off after him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now some Greeks were among those who had gone up to worship at the feast.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these approached Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and requested, “Sir, we would like to see Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went and told Andrew, and they both went and told Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, unless a kernel of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it produces much grain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who loves his life destroys it, and the one who hates his life in this world guards it for eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone wants to serve me, he must follow me, and where I am, my servant will be too. If anyone serves me, the Father will honor him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now my soul is greatly distressed. And what should I say? ‘Father, deliver me from this hour’? No, but for this very reason I have come to this hour.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Father, glorify your name.” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd that stood there and heard the voice said that it had thundered. Others said that an angel had spoken to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “This voice has not come for my benefit but for yours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be driven out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now he said this to indicate clearly what kind of death he was going to die.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the crowd responded, “We have heard from the law that the Christ will remain forever. How can you say, ‘The Son of Man must be lifted up’? Who is this Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “The light is with you for a little while longer. Walk while you have the light, so that the darkness may not overtake you. The one who walks in the darkness does not know where he is going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While you have the light, believe in the light, so that you may become sons of light.” When Jesus had said these things, he went away and hid himself from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Although Jesus had performed so many miraculous signs before them, they still refused to believe in him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that the word of the prophet Isaiah would be fulfilled. He said, “Lord, who has believed our message, and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason they could not believe, because again Isaiah said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“He has blinded their eyes
and hardened their heart,
so that they would not see with their eyes
and understand with their heart,
and turn to me, and I would heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah said these things because he saw Christ’s glory, and spoke about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nevertheless, even among the rulers many believed in him, but because of the Pharisees they would not confess Jesus to be the Christ, so that they would not be put out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they loved praise from men more than praise from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus shouted out, “The one who believes in me does not believe in me, but in the one who sent me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the one who sees me sees the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come as a light into the world, so that everyone who believes in me should not remain in darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone hears my words and does not obey them, I do not judge him. For I have not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who rejects me and does not accept my words has a judge; the word I have spoken will judge him at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have not spoken from my own authority, but the Father himself who sent me has commanded me what I should say and what I should speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know that his commandment is eternal life. Thus the things I say, I say just as the Father has told me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just before the Passover Feast, Jesus knew that his time had come to depart from this world to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he now loved them to the very end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The evening meal was in progress, and the devil had already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, that he should betray Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because Jesus knew that the Father had handed all things over to him, and that he had come from God and was going back to God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he got up from the meal, removed his outer clothes, took a towel and tied it around himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He poured water into the washbasin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to dry them with the towel he had wrapped around himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he came to Simon Peter. Peter said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You do not understand what I am doing now, but you will understand after these things.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet!” Jesus replied, “If I do not wash you, you have no share with me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, wash not only my feet, but also my hands and my head!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “The one who has bathed needs only to wash his feet, but is completely clean. And you disciples are clean, but not every one of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For Jesus knew the one who was going to betray him. For this reason he said, “Not every one of you is clean.”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Jesus had washed their feet and put his outer clothing back on, he took his place at the table again and said to them, “Do you understand what I have done for you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and do so correctly, for that is what I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I then, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you too ought to wash one another’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have given you an example—you should do just as I have done for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, the slave is not greater than his master, nor is the one who is sent as a messenger greater than the one who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you understand these things, you will be blessed if you do them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What I am saying does not refer to all of you. I know the ones I have chosen. But this is to fulfill the scripture, ‘The one who eats my bread has turned against me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am telling you this now, before it happens, so that when it happens you may believe that I am he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, whoever accepts the one I send accepts me, and whoever accepts me accepts the one who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said these things, Jesus was greatly distressed in spirit, and testified, “I tell you the solemn truth, one of you will betray me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples began to look at one another, worried and perplexed to know which of them he was talking about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of his disciples, the one Jesus loved, was at the table to the right of Jesus in a place of honor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter gestured to this disciple to ask Jesus who it was he was referring to.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved leaned back against Jesus’ chest and asked him, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “It is the one to whom I will give this piece of bread after I have dipped it in the dish.” Then he dipped the piece of bread in the dish and gave it to Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after Judas took the piece of bread, Satan entered into him. Jesus said to him, “What you are about to do, do quickly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now none of those present at the table understood why Jesus said this to Judas.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some thought that, because Judas had the money box, Jesus was telling him to buy whatever they needed for the feast, or to give something to the poor.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas took the piece of bread and went out immediately. (Now it was night.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judas had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man is glorified, and God is glorified in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If God is glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself, and he will glorify him right away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Children, I am still with you for a little while. You will look for me, and just as I said to the Jewish religious leaders, ‘Where I am going you cannot come,’ now I tell you the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I give you a new commandment—to love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also are to love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone will know by this that you are my disciples—if you have love for one another.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus replied, “Where I am going, you cannot follow me now, but you will follow later.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter said to him, “Lord, why can’t I follow you now? I will lay down my life for you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Will you lay down your life for me? I tell you the solemn truth, the rooster will not crow until you have denied me three times!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Do not let your hearts be distressed. You believe in God; believe also in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are many dwelling places in my Father’s house. Otherwise, I would have told you, because I am going away to make ready a place for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I go and make ready a place for you, I will come again and take you to be with me, so that where I am you may be too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know the way where I am going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas said, “Lord, we don’t know where you are going. How can we know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I am the way, and the truth, and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you have known me, you will know my Father too. And from now on you do know him and have seen him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said, “Lord, show us the Father, and we will be content.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Have I been with you for so long, and you have not known me, Philip? The person who has seen me has seen the Father! How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you, I do not speak on my own initiative, but the Father residing in me performs his miraculous deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me, but if you do not believe me, believe because of the miraculous deeds themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, the person who believes in me will perform the miraculous deeds that I am doing, and will perform greater deeds than these, because I am going to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you ask me anything in my name, I will do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love me, you will obey my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate to be with you forever—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot accept, because it does not see him or know him. But you know him, because he resides with you and will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I will not abandon you as orphans, I will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a little while the world will not see me any longer, but you will see me; because I live, you will live too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will know at that time that I am in my Father and you are in me and I am in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who has my commandments and obeys them is the one who loves me. The one who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will reveal myself to him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Lord,” Judas (not Judas Iscariot) said, “what has happened that you are going to reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If anyone loves me, he will obey my word, and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and take up residence with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The person who does not love me does not obey my words. And the word you hear is not mine, but the Father’s who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have spoken these things while staying with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you everything, and will cause you to remember everything I said to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you; I do not give it to you as the world does. Do not let your hearts be distressed or lacking in courage.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You heard me say to you, ‘I am going away and I am coming back to you.’ If you loved me, you would be glad that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you now before it happens, so that when it happens you may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not speak with you much longer, for the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I am doing just what the Father commanded me, so that the world may know that I love the Father. Get up, let us go from here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true vine and my Father is the gardener.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He takes away every branch that does not bear fruit in me. He prunes every branch that bears fruit so that it will bear more fruit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are clean already because of the word that I have spoken to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain in me, and I will remain in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit by itself, unless it remains in the vine, so neither can you unless you remain in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the vine; you are the branches. The one who remains in me—and I in him—bears much fruit, because apart from me you can accomplish nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If anyone does not remain in me, he is thrown out like a branch, and dries up; and such branches are gathered up and thrown into the fire, and are burned up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you remain in me and my words remain in you, ask whatever you want, and it will be done for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My Father is honored by this, that you bear much fruit and show that you are my disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Just as the Father has loved me, I have also loved you; remain in my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you obey my commandments, you will remain in my love, just as I have obeyed my Father’s commandments and remain in his love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you these things so that my joy may be in you, and your joy may be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My commandment is this—to love one another just as I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has greater love than this—that one lays down his life for his friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are my friends if you do what I command you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I no longer call you slaves, because the slave does not understand what his master is doing. But I have called you friends, because I have revealed to you everything I heard from my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You did not choose me, but I chose you and appointed you to go and bear fruit, fruit that remains, so that whatever you ask the Father in my name he will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This I command you—to love one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the world hates you, be aware that it hated me first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you belonged to the world, the world would love you as its own. However, because you do not belong to the world, but I chose you out of the world, for this reason the world hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what I told you, ‘A slave is not greater than his master.’ If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you. If they obeyed my word, they will obey yours too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they will do all these things to you on account of my name, because they do not know the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not be guilty of sin. But they no longer have any excuse for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who hates me hates my Father too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I had not performed among them the miraculous deeds that no one else did, they would not be guilty of sin. But now they have seen the deeds and have hated both me and my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this happened to fulfill the word that is written in their law, ‘They hated me without reason.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Advocate comes, whom I will send you from the Father—the Spirit of truth who goes out from the Father—he will testify about me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you also will testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you all these things so that you will not fall away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will put you out of the synagogue, yet a time is coming when the one who kills you will think he is offering service to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will do these things because they have not known the Father or me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I have told you these things so that when their time comes, you will remember that I told you about them.
“I did not tell you these things from the beginning because I was with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I am going to the one who sent me, and not one of you is asking me, ‘Where are you going?’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead your hearts are filled with sadness because I have said these things to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I tell you the truth, it is to your advantage that I am going away. For if I do not go away, the Advocate will not come to you, but if I go, I will send him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he comes, he will prove the world wrong concerning sin and righteousness and judgment—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning sin, because they do not believe in me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: concerning righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you will see me no longer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have many more things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when he, the Spirit of truth, comes, he will guide you into all truth. For he will not speak on his own authority, but will speak whatever he hears, and will tell you what is to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will glorify me, because he will receive from me what is mine and will tell it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything that the Father has is mine; that is why I said the Spirit will receive from me what is mine and will tell it to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In a little while you will see me no longer; again after a little while, you will see me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then some of his disciples said to one another, “What is the meaning of what he is saying, ‘In a little while you will not see me; again after a little while, you will see me,’ and, ‘because I am going to the Father’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they kept on repeating, “What is the meaning of what he says, ‘In a little while’? We do not understand what he is talking about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus could see that they wanted to ask him about these things, so he said to them, “Are you asking each other about this—that I said, ‘In a little while you will not see me; again after a little while, you will see me’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, you will weep and wail, but the world will rejoice; you will be sad, but your sadness will turn into joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When a woman gives birth, she has distress because her time has come, but when her child is born, she no longer remembers the suffering because of her joy that a human being has been born into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So also you have sorrow now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time you will ask me nothing. I tell you the solemn truth, whatever you ask the Father in my name he will give you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive it, so that your joy may be complete.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you these things in obscure figures of speech; a time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in obscure figures, but will tell you plainly about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time you will ask in my name, and I do not say that I will ask the Father on your behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father himself loves you, because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I came from the Father and entered into the world, but in turn, I am leaving the world and going back to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples said, “Look, now you are speaking plainly and not in obscure figures of speech!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we know that you know everything and do not need anyone to ask you anything. Because of this we believe that you have come from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Do you now believe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look, a time is coming—and has come—when you will be scattered, each one to his own home, and I will be left alone. Yet I am not alone, because my Father is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you these things so that in me you may have peace. In the world you have trouble and suffering, but take courage—I have conquered the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had finished saying these things, he looked upward to heaven and said, “Father, the time has come. Glorify your Son, so that your Son may glorify you—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you have given him authority over all humanity, so that he may give eternal life to everyone you have given him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now this is eternal life—that they know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you sent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I glorified you on earth by completing the work you gave me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And now, Father, glorify me at your side with the glory I had with you before the world was created.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have revealed your name to the men you gave me out of the world. They belonged to you, and you gave them to me, and they have obeyed your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they understand that everything you have given me comes from you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I have given them the words you have given me. They accepted them and really understand that I came from you, and they believed that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am praying on behalf of them. I am not praying on behalf of the world, but on behalf of those you have given me, because they belong to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everything I have belongs to you, and everything you have belongs to me, and I have been glorified by them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, keep them safe in your name that you have given me, so that they may be one just as we are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was with them I kept them safe and watched over them in your name that you have given me. Not one of them was lost except the one destined for destruction, so that the scripture could be fulfilled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But now I am coming to you, and I am saying these things in the world, so they may experience my joy completed in themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them your word, and the world has hated them, because they do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not asking you to take them out of the world, but that you keep them safe from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They do not belong to the world just as I do not belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Set them apart in the truth; your word is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as you sent me into the world, so I sent them into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I set myself apart on their behalf, so that they too may be truly set apart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am not praying only on their behalf, but also on behalf of those who believe in me through their testimony,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that they will all be one, just as you, Father, are in me and I am in you. I pray that they will be in us, so that the world will believe that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The glory you gave to me I have given to them, that they may be one just as we are one—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I in them and you in me—that they may be completely one, so that the world will know that you sent me, and you have loved them just as you have loved me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Father, I want those you have given me to be with me where I am, so that they can see my glory that you gave me because you loved me before the creation of the world .
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteous Father, even if the world does not know you, I know you, and these men know that you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I made known your name to them, and I will continue to make it known, so that the love you have loved me with may be in them, and I may be in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said these things, Jesus went out with his disciples across the Kidron Valley. There was an orchard there, and he and his disciples went into it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Judas, the one who betrayed him, knew the place too, because Jesus had met there many times with his disciples.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas obtained a squad of soldiers and some officers of the chief priests and Pharisees. They came to the orchard with lanterns and torches and weapons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus, because he knew everything that was going to happen to him, came and asked them, “Who are you looking for?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “Jesus the Nazarene.” He told them, “I am he.” (Now Judas, the one who betrayed him, was standing there with them.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Jesus said to them, “I am he,” they retreated and fell to the ground.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus asked them again, “Who are you looking for?” And they said, “Jesus the Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I told you that I am he. If you are looking for me, let these men go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to fulfill the word he had spoken, “I have not lost a single one of those whom you gave me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, pulled it out and struck the high priest’s slave, cutting off his right ear. (Now the slave’s name was Malchus.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back into its sheath! Am I not to drink the cup that the Father has given me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the squad of soldiers with their commanding officer and the officers of the Jewish leaders arrested Jesus and tied him up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They brought him first to Annas, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now it was Caiaphas who had advised the Jewish leaders that it was to their advantage that one man die for the people.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter and another disciple followed them as they brought Jesus to Annas. (Now the other disciple was acquainted with the high priest, and he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Peter was left standing outside by the door. So the other disciple who was acquainted with the high priest came out and spoke to the slave girl who watched the door, and brought Peter inside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The girl who was the doorkeeper said to Peter, “You’re not one of this man’s disciples too, are you?” He replied, “I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now the slaves and the guards were standing around a charcoal fire they had made, warming themselves because it was cold. Peter also was standing with them, warming himself.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While this was happening, the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I have spoken publicly to the world. I always taught in the synagogues and in the temple courts, where all the Jewish people assemble together. I have said nothing in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why do you ask me? Ask those who heard what I said. They know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had said this, one of the high priest’s officers who stood nearby struck him on the face and said, “Is that the way you answer the high priest?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If I have said something wrong, confirm what is wrong. But if I spoke correctly, why strike me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Annas sent him, still tied up, to Caiaphas the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile Simon Peter was standing in the courtyard warming himself. They said to him, “You aren’t one of his disciples too, are you?” Peter denied it: “I am not!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the high priest’s slaves, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Did I not see you in the orchard with him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter denied it again, and immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they brought Jesus from Caiaphas to the Roman governor’s residence. (Now it was very early morning.) They did not go into the governor’s residence so they would not be ceremonially defiled, but could eat the Passover meal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate came outside to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “If this man were not a criminal, we would not have handed him over to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate told them, “Take him yourselves and pass judgment on him according to your own law!” The Jewish leaders replied, “We cannot legally put anyone to death.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This happened to fulfill the word Jesus had spoken when he indicated what kind of death he was going to die.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate went back into the governor’s residence, summoned Jesus, and asked him, “Are you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Are you saying this on your own initiative, or have others told you about me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your own people and your chief priests handed you over to me. What have you done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “My kingdom is not from this world. If my kingdom were from this world, my servants would be fighting to keep me from being handed over to the Jewish authorities. But as it is, my kingdom is not from here.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate said, “So you are a king!” Jesus replied, “You say that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I came into the world—to testify to the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to my voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate asked, “What is truth?”
When he had said this he went back outside to the Jewish leaders and announced, “I find no basis for an accusation against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But it is your custom that I release one prisoner for you at the Passover. So do you want me to release for you the king of the Jews?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shouted back, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” (Now Barabbas was a revolutionary.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged severely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers braided a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and they clothed him in a purple robe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They came up to him again and again and said, “Hail, king of the Jews!” And they struck him repeatedly in the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Pilate went out and said to the Jewish leaders, “Look, I am bringing him out to you, so that you may know that I find no reason for an accusation against him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus came outside, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Look, here is the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the chief priests and their officers saw him, they shouted out, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said, “You take him and crucify him! Certainly I find no reason for an accusation against him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders replied, “We have a law, and according to our law he ought to die, because he claimed to be the Son of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard what they said, he was more afraid than ever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he went back into the governor’s residence and said to Jesus, “Where do you come from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate said, “Do you refuse to speak to me? Don’t you know I have the authority to release you, and to crucify you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You would have no authority over me at all, unless it was given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From this point on, Pilate tried to release him. But the Jewish leaders shouted out, “If you release this man, you are no friend of Caesar! Everyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard these words he brought Jesus outside and sat down on the judgment seat in the place called “The Stone Pavement” (Gabbatha in Aramaic).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now it was the day of preparation for the Passover, about noon.) Pilate said to the Jewish leaders, “Look, here is your king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they shouted out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate asked, “Shall I crucify your king?” The high priests replied, “We have no king except Caesar!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified.
So they took Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and carrying his own cross he went out to the place called “The Place of the Skull” (called in Aramaic Golgotha).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they crucified him along with two others, one on each side, with Jesus in the middle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate also had a notice written and fastened to the cross, which read: “Jesus the Nazarene, the king of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thus many of the Jewish residents of Jerusalem read this notice, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the notice was written in Aramaic, Latin, and Greek.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The king of the Jews,’ but rather, ‘This man said, I am king of the Jews.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and made four shares, one for each soldier, and the tunic remained. (Now the tunic was seamless, woven from top to bottom as a single piece.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but throw dice to see who will get it.” This took place to fulfill the scripture that says, “They divided my garments among them, and for my clothing they threw dice.” So the soldiers did these things.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now standing beside Jesus’ cross were his mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing there, he said to his mother, “Woman, look, here is your son!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He then said to his disciple, “Look, here is your mother!” From that very time the disciple took her into his own home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus, realizing that by this time everything was completed, said (in order to fulfill the scripture), “I am thirsty!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A jar full of sour wine was there, so they put a sponge soaked in sour wine on a branch of hyssop and lifted it to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had received the sour wine, Jesus said, “It is completed!” Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, because it was the day of preparation, so that the bodies should not stay on the crosses on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was an especially important one), the Jewish leaders asked Pilate to have the victims’ legs broken and the bodies taken down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the two men who had been crucified with Jesus, first the one and then the other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and blood and water flowed out immediately.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the person who saw it has testified (and his testimony is true, and he knows that he is telling the truth), so that you also may believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For these things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled, “Not a bone of his will be broken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And again another scripture says, “They will look on the one whom they have pierced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Joseph of Arimathea, a disciple of Jesus (but secretly, because he feared the Jewish leaders), asked Pilate if he could remove the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, so he went and took the body away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Nicodemus, the man who had previously come to Jesus at night, accompanied Joseph, carrying a mixture of myrrh and aloes weighing about seventy-five pounds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took Jesus’ body and wrapped it, with the aromatic spices, in strips of linen cloth according to Jewish burial customs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now at the place where Jesus was crucified there was a garden, and in the garden was a new tomb where no one had yet been buried.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so, because it was the Jewish day of preparation and the tomb was nearby, they placed Jesus’ body there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now very early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and saw that the stone had been moved away from the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So she went running to Simon Peter and the other disciple whom Jesus loved and told them, “They have taken the Lord from the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Peter and the other disciple set out to go to the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The two were running together, but the other disciple ran faster than Peter and reached the tomb first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He bent down and saw the strips of linen cloth lying there, but he did not go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter, who had been following him, arrived and went right into the tomb. He saw the strips of linen cloth lying there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the face cloth, which had been around Jesus’ head, not lying with the strips of linen cloth but rolled up in a place by itself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, came in, and he saw and believed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (For they did not yet understand the scripture that Jesus must rise from the dead.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the disciples went back to their homes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Mary stood outside the tomb weeping. As she wept, she bent down and looked into the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And she saw two angels in white sitting where Jesus’ body had been lying, one at the head and one at the feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” Mary replied, “They have taken my Lord away, and I do not know where they have put him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” Because she thought he was the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will take him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to her, “Mary.” She turned and said to him in Aramaic, “Rabboni” (which means Teacher).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Do not touch me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father. Go to my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene came and informed the disciples, “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them what Jesus had said to her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the evening of that day, the first day of the week, the disciples had gathered together and locked the doors of the place because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Jesus came and stood among them and said to them, “Peace be with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he had said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. Just as the Father has sent me, I also send you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after he said this, he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forgive anyone’s sins, they are forgiven; if you retain anyone’s sins, they are retained.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Thomas (called Didymus), one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he replied, “Unless I see the wounds from the nails in his hands, and put my finger into the wounds from the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe it!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eight days later the disciples were again together in the house, and Thomas was with them. Although the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and examine my hands. Extend your hand and put it into my side. Do not continue in your unbelief, but believe.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas replied to him, “My Lord and my God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to him, “Have you believed because you have seen me? Blessed are the people who have not seen and yet have believed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus performed many other miraculous signs in the presence of the disciples, which are not recorded in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these are recorded so that you may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God, and that by believing you may have life in his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this Jesus revealed himself again to the disciples by the Sea of Tiberias. Now this is how he did so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter, Thomas (called Didymus), Nathanael (who was from Cana in Galilee), the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples of his were together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter told them, “I am going fishing.” “We will go with you,” they replied. They went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When it was already very early morning, Jesus stood on the beach, but the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said to them, “Children, you don’t have any fish, do you?” They replied, “No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “Throw your net on the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they threw the net, and were not able to pull it in because of the large number of fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” So Simon Peter, when he heard that it was the Lord, tucked in his outer garment (for he had nothing on underneath it), and plunged into the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile the other disciples came with the boat, dragging the net full of fish, for they were not far from land, only about a hundred yards.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they got out on the beach, they saw a charcoal fire ready with a fish placed on it, and bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “Bring some of the fish you have just now caught.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter went aboard and pulled the net to shore. It was full of large fish, 153, but although there were so many, the net was not torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come, have breakfast,” Jesus said. But none of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them, and did the same with the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was now the third time Jesus was revealed to the disciples after he was raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then when they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love me more than these do?” He replied, “Yes, Lord, you know I love you.” Jesus told him, “Feed my lambs.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” He replied, “Yes, Lord, you know I love you.” Jesus told him, “Shepherd my sheep.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said a third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love me?” Peter was distressed that Jesus asked him a third time, “Do you love me?” and said, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you.” Jesus replied, “Feed my sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the solemn truth, when you were young, you tied your clothes around you and went wherever you wanted, but when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and others will tie you up and bring you where you do not want to go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Now Jesus said this to indicate clearly by what kind of death Peter was going to glorify God.) After he said this, Jesus told Peter, “Follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter turned around and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them. (This was the disciple who had leaned back against Jesus’ chest at the meal and asked, “Lord, who is the one who is going to betray you?”)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when Peter saw him, he asked Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If I want him to live until I come back, what concern is that of yours? You follow me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the saying circulated among the brothers and sisters that this disciple was not going to die. But Jesus did not say to him that he was not going to die, but rather, “If I want him to live until I come back, what concern is that of yours?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the disciple who testifies about these things and has written these things, and we know that his testimony is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There are many other things that Jesus did. If every one of them were written down, I suppose the whole world would not have room for the books that would be written.
verses.speaker: Narrator
